videos.title: GIVĒON - TWENTIES (2025)
videos.additional_info:
GIVĒON - TWENTIES (2025)
A cinematic reflection on youth, ambition, and the bittersweet passage of time. Directed by Loris Russier, with stunning cinematography by Edouard Le Grelle and rich, moody color grading by Jacob McKee, the video immerses viewers in a visually striking journey through late-night cityscapes, fleeting romance, and moments of introspection. Blending elegance with raw emotion, "Twenties" captures the highs and lows of coming of age, wrapped in GIVĒON’s signature soulful sound. Director - @lorisrussier Production Company - @lotumn_ Executive Producer / Producer - @autumnmaschi Executive Producer - @lorisrussier Director Of Photography - @edlegrelle Creative Director: @riko_akme Giveon Stylist - @yashuasimmons Management - @eeekksss, Simon Gebrelul Epic Head of Video Production - @gstarsz Starring - @ayomideadeduro
Technique - Close-Up , Quick Cuts
Director - Loris Russier
DOP - Edouard Le Grelle
Editor - Jacob McKee
Original Source - Link
MUSIC
REFLECTION
MUSICIAN
M

videos.title: Watchtower of Turkey (2014)
videos.description: Described as a visual masterpiece, "Watchtower of Turkey" is praised for its breathtaking cinematography, dynamic soundtrack, and impeccable editing. The film takes viewers through vibrant cities and awe-inspiring landscapes, showcasing the country's remarkable diversity and beauty. It's more than just a travel video; it's a tribute to Turkey's rich culture, history, and natural wonders, crafted with an eye for detail and a knack for storytelling.

videos.title: Valentino Khan - Deep Down Low (2016)
videos.description: One of the weirdest music videos you'll ever watch. We don't recommend watching while high. Actually scratch that. Even better when high. Fever, hallucinogens, or the hypnotic beat at the track make his nightmares increasingly bizarre. In the restaurant, dancing facial features and tentacles sprouting from a waitress's eyes push him to flee the surreal scene.

videos.title: Vince Staples - Norf Norf (2015)
videos.description: The music video for "Norf Norf" by Vince Staples, released in 2015, features documentary-style footage that portrays the harsh realities of life in North Long Beach, California. Through scenes of Vince in a police car and visuals of his neighborhood, the video underscores the song's themes of systemic injustice and police brutality.
videos.additional_info:
Vince Staples - Norf Norf (2015)
The music video for "Norf Norf" by Vince Staples, released in 2015, features documentary-style footage that portrays the harsh realities of life in North Long Beach, California. Through scenes of Vince in a police car and visuals of his neighborhood, the video underscores the song's themes of systemic injustice and police brutality.
Technique - Haze , Quick Cuts
Director - Spike Jordan, Vince Staples

videos.alt_text: Pa Salieu - My Family feat BackRoad Gee
videos.title: Pa Salieu - My Family feat BackRoad Gee (2020)
videos.additional_info:
Pa Salieu - My Family feat BackRoad Gee (2020)
Music video for British rapper Pa Salieu, from director Femi Ladi. Utilizes a bolt arm camera that was popularized in Kendrick Lamar's 2017 music video, Humble, by director Dave Meyers. Ladi's decision to use a black and white color scheme gives this film an interesting juxtaposition between a timeless look, and modern camera techniques, with the help of the bolt arm.
Technique - Quick Cuts , Speed Ramp
Director - Femi Ladi
DOP - Stefan Yap

videos.title: Vince Staples - Norf Norf (2015)
videos.description: The music video for "Norf Norf" by Vince Staples, released in 2015, features documentary-style footage that portrays the harsh realities of life in North Long Beach, California. Through scenes of Vince in a police car and visuals of his neighborhood, the video underscores the song's themes of systemic injustice and police brutality.

videos.alt_text: Sabrina Carpenter Ft. Jenna Ortega - Taste
videos.title: Sabrina Carpenter Ft. Jenna Ortega - Taste (2024)
videos.description: In Sabrina Carpenter's music video for "Taste," co-starring Jenna Ortega, the duo engage in a gory, darkly comedic rivalry over a two-timing boyfriend. Directed by Dave Meyers, the video features numerous campy horror and cult film references, including scenes inspired by Death Becomes Her and Kill Bill. Carpenter and Ortega repeatedly murder each other in elaborate ways, including stabbings, voodoo dolls, and falls from great heights, only to make up with a kiss. In collaboration with Jacobi Mehringer, Anna Arnell, and Lizzy Walker.
videos.additional_info:
Sabrina Carpenter Ft. Jenna Ortega - Taste (2024)
In Sabrina Carpenter's music video for "Taste," co-starring Jenna Ortega, the duo engage in a gory, darkly comedic rivalry over a two-timing boyfriend. Carpenter and Ortega repeatedly murder each other in elaborate ways, including stabbings, voodoo dolls, and falls from great heights, only to make up with a kiss. In collaboration with Jacobi Mehringer, Anna Arnell, and Lizzy Walker.

videos.title: Flume feat. MAY-A - Say Nothing (2022)
videos.description: The music video for "Say Nothing" by Flume featuring MAY-A, directed by Michael Hili, offers a visually captivating and surreal experience. It includes psychedelic visuals, with Flume donning a bleach-blonde hairstyle and posing on motorcycles, while MAY-A is seen submerged in black sand. The video uses stark contrasts and vibrant colors to complement the song's themes of post-relationship clarity and emotional expression. This trippy and avant-garde style enhances the song's narrative, making it a standout piece in Flume's discography.
videos.additional_info:

The video uses stark contrasts and vibrant colors to complement the song's themes of post-relationship clarity and emotional expression. This trippy and avant-garde style enhances the song's narrative, making it a standout piece in Flume's discography.

videos.title: 21 Savage - redrum (2024)
videos.description: The music video for "Redrum" by 21 Savage, featured on his album "American Dream," is directed by Danny Seth and showcases a return to the artist's roots in London. It contrasts iconic landmarks with the grittier areas of Brixton, symbolizing the song's themes. The track itself, produced by London on da Track, samples "Serenata do Adeus" and incorporates elements from "The Shining," including the famous line "Here's Johnny!" Despite some opinions that the video could have more directly referenced "The Shining's" iconic scenes, it has been well-received for its artistic representation and Savage's performance.
videos.additional_info:
21 Savage - redrum (2024)
The music video for "Redrum" by 21 Savage, featured on his album "American Dream," is directed by Danny Seth and showcases a return to the artist's roots in London. It contrasts iconic landmarks with the grittier areas of Brixton, symbolizing the song's themes. The track itself, produced by London on da Track, samples "Serenata do Adeus" and incorporates elements from "The Shining," including the famous line "Here's Johnny!" Despite some opinions that the video could have more directly referenced "The Shining's" iconic scenes, it has been well-received for its artistic representation and Savage's performance.
Technique - Quick Cuts
Director - Danny Seth
DOP - Chewy Lodge, JAWMIDNIGHT, Thomas Marchese
Editor - Alex Liu, Alex Morrison
